data.title: The Red Badge of Courage: Crane, Stephen: 9781508482765: Amazon.com: Books
data.meta_description: The Red Badge of Courage [Crane, Stephen] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. The Red Badge of Courage
data.text:
Customers find the writing style fantastic, excellent, and thought-provoking. They also say it's a great first person narrative and better than expected. Customers also mention the book is great for people of all ages and an easy read.

"This book is a classic book all people should read to help restore their faith in the country and gain a new gratitude of the history that allows..." Read more

"...It is verisimilitude at its finest -- but as tight as prose can be. Sparse and yet rich, layered and textured in imagery and language...." Read more

Customers find the story timeless, well-written, and describe the battles from a new perspective. They also say the book is a great read on the horrors and trials of life in the civil war.

"...This is a great story, gritty characters and a description of a battle in a most disastrous era of our Nation's history." Read more

"...A great story of coming into manhood.The whole story is the battlefield, I am amazed at how Mr. Crane could keep the prose going so fluidly." Read more

Customers find the book gives great insight into the mind of a young soldier during his first battle. They also say it's chock full of feelings and emotions, reaches into the heart of true courage, and is full of conversation with a dialect in some instances. Readers also say the book is good for info on the civil war and excellent for its day.

"...As a fanatic for history in general I found this book to be very interesting. Without a doubt this is a must for historians and avid history readers...." Read more

"...This story is full of conversation with a dialect in some instances of backwoods farm boys. It has good characterization...." Read more

Customers are mixed about the readability. Some find the writing vivid and descriptive, and the story is simple and short. They also appreciate the excellent descriptions and use of the English language. However, some find the style difficult to understand and the street talk hard to follow at times.

"...not like the authors writing style and at times found the wording difficult to understand, Crane certainly conveys the feelings of the youth well..." Read more

"...The book is exciting, well written and an easy read. The first edition was in 1895, but it could have been written at any time...." Read more

Customers find the book repetitive, boring, and rambling. They also say it's not for the average reader, and parts are gory. Readers also mention that the book lacks attention to the emotional impacts and provides little actual action.

"...attempts to do so while commendable are undermined by his being very repetitious and ultimately somewhat boring...." Read more

"...With that said this book is not for the average reader, as at certain points I found myself bored and wishing for the writer to continue with the..." Read more

"Most exciting book that I have re-read! I read the book as a teenager and it made such an impression that I became interested in history and more...." Read more
